name: Dunkery Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent one night in the Dunster room at Dunkery Lodge as part of a last-minute countryside weekend. The room was immaculate and comfortable, with lots of space and storage (for those staying longer). The en-suite was a reasonable size with a good shower. Lots of windows with views of the garden and surrounding hills. Quality linens, iron, hair dryer all supplied. Room had good lighting for reading, either in the two armchairs or in the bed. Tea/coffee and kettle in-room, with milk in a fridge in the corridor.
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Paul was a lovely host, happy to discuss options in the area and further afield. Wollacombe Beach is about an hour further west on the other side of Exmoor. Good for swimming/surfing even at low tide. The location of Dunkery Lodge is very convenient, and there are plenty of shops/restaurants/the seafront within walking distance. Nearby village/castle of Dunster is also worth a look.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Breakfast was outstanding, and Paul takes his food seriously: he opted not to serve some fish which he wasn't totally happy with, as opposed to just passing it off as some lesser hosts might have. I appreciate this dilligence and care very much! Should we return to the Minehead area, we will be back to Dunkery Lodge. Thank you Paul!
reviews.title: Great Value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely stay, light and airy room with good views and quite despite being close to a road you wouldn't know it when inside.
reviews.title: shear pleasure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Room – The Dunster Room
reviews.title: Amazing.........................

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was spacious with a view of hills outside the town. Although the road is one of the main roads into town the traffic noise is not disturbing. Lovely and clean with en-suite shower, plenty of towels, a kingsize bed and thoughtfully placed drinks making table with access to fresh milk.
reviews.title: Very comfortable with hotel standard rooms and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dinner can be booked in advance here, and we were very impressed by the standard of cooking - very professionally done with excellent presentation, a choice of good wines and very good value.
reviews.title: Beyond all criticism

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, highly recommended, we will definitely return.
reviews.title: This is the place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: Our locomotive was booked for the West Somerset Gala and needing somewhere to stay so we consulted tripadvisor site. As we were staying for 8 nights we wanted something above the ordinary guesthouse. Boy did we get it!
reviews.title: Comfortable and homely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: There is nothing to criticise about Dukery Lodge, evrything writtten by others on this site is true, their rooms, cleanlyness, food and our host was excellent.
reviews.title: Spot On

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I recently spent a week at the Dunkery Lodge with my early-teens son. We were made to feel welcome and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The room was very comfortable, in good condition and well equipped. The breakfast is escellent with a very wide range of choice and very well prepared. The swimming poolis even better than the pictures suggest and we made use of it everyday to unwind after a day of sightseeing or walking on the hills/coastpaths. Would thoroughly recommend for couples, singles or small family groups with older childen.
reviews.title: Perfect for our week's holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Very friendly B&B with big spacious rooms, very clean and an amazing breakfast. Fresh berries to Smoothie to full English breakfast - whatever your heart desires. They also do a good packed lunch for hiking trips.
reviews.title: We loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Just stayed here the one night, as was working in the area. Welcoming hosts, great room, slept like a log!! Breakfast spread appetising and varied.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful 2 night stay at Dunkery Lodge. The room and the en suite were lovely, clean and spacious. The bed was huge and really comfortable. All our needs were thought of to make our stay homely and enjoyable, including an assortment of beverages and fresh milk available in our room. Our hosts, Judy and Paul were really helpful and friendly. The breakfast was very tasty and perfectly cooked. The garden is lovely and is perfect to sit and relax in the sunshine. The local area is beautiful with lots of walks and fantastic scenery. We hope to return soon and will gladly recommend it to others
reviews.title: The Perfect Bed and Breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service was excellant, the room spacious, comfortable with two nice easy chairs, a television and ample storeage space for clothes etc. The location within easy reach of the town centre and sea front, ample car parking space, off road, and a garden with an outdoor swimming pool.
reviews.title: We enjoyed every minute of our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Dunkery Lodge, firstly has a welcoming car park, in the beautiful grounds, with its own heated swimming pool. Our room, The Dunster, was attractive, clean and spacious with a large bathroom. The award winning breakfasts kept us going each day until well after lunchtime. Paul and Judy were great hosts and made you feel welcome from the moment you arrived. Town centre is just a short walk away. Minehead itself if an excellent base for exploring Exmoor and surrounding countryside, which is breathtakingly beautiful. Paul gave us plenty of informatoin for suggested day trips and walks. The days flew by so quickly, we will be returning again to Dunkery Lodge, as there is so much to explore.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The Dunkery Lodge is a delightful place to stay while on holiday in the south of England. The rooms are most accommodating and beautifully decorated. The breakfast simply cannot be beaten. There was so much to choose from. It was served quickly, beautifully, and tasted wonderful. \you cannot go wrong by booking a stay at the Dunkerly.
reviews.title: Wonderful visit in Somerset

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my first time at this B&B, but my partner had stayed previously. The hosts Paul and Judy were lovely. Really friendly and eager to help. Accommodation was clean, modern and quiet. The position of the B&B within Minehead was very convenient and within walking distance of the town centre, Quay and Pubs. Breakfast was plentiful, with lots of choice. The poached eggs were fantastic! Great value for money and will definitely be back.
reviews.title: Peaceful and Pleasant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were made to feel extremely welcome from the moment we arrived. The bedroom was large, airy, and extremely comfortable with en-suite facilities of a high standard. The food was sensational - what a chef! Beautiful gardens with swimming pool.
reviews.title: Marvellous Welcome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Will definitely return and would highly recommend to a friend. Only 10 minute walk into town/sea front.
reviews.title: well appointed B/B

description: Dunkery Lodge is a spacious and attractive period house set in it’s own grounds with secure off-street parking and a heated swimming pool. We offer a base for short breaks and longer holidays for those wishing to explore the Exmoor coast and countryside or just needing to relax in comfortable surroundings. Our newly decorated en-suite bedrooms are furnished to a high standard complete with multi-media flat screen TVs, hair drier, iron and ironing board, wireless internet connection, beverage facilities, and views of our garden and surrounding hill-side.
